member.name: T:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.C1InputPanelBase
member.summary: The base class for .

summary.para: Control that hosts a set of components and provides automatic binding, layout, and styling.

When you bind the C1InputPanel to a data source object at design time, the control is automatically populated with components used to view and edit the data in the data source, including keyboard accelerators.
The automatic layout mechanism ensures that the alignment and tab order are correct, and is automatically updated when elements are added or removed from the control.
All components share a common set of styles, properties, methods, and events, which makes programming the C1InputPanel easy and consistent.

member.summary: Gets or sets the specific list in a object that the panel should display.

remarks.para: If a contains multiple sources of data, you should set the property to one of the sources.
For example, if the DataSource is a contains three tables named Customers, Orders, and OrderDetails, you must specify one of the tables to bind to.
If the contains only one , you may set the DataMember property to an empty string.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.C1InputPanel.ToolTipLinkClicked
member.summary: Event that fires when the user clicks a hyperlink within a tooltip.

remarks.para: By default, tooltips are invisible to the mouse and therefore cannot be clicked. You must set the property is to true in order to make the tooltip visible to the mouse (and clickable).

Hyperlinks are created using "A" tags in the HTML source text. When hyperlinks are clicked, the ToolTipLinkClicked event fires and provides information about the link. The event handler can then take appropriate action.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings
member.summary: Exposes properties of the built-in tooltip.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tooltip is currently active.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.AutomaticDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the automatic delay for the rich tooltip.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.AutoPopDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the period of time (in milliseconds) the tooltip remains visible if the mouse pointer is stationary within a control.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.ShowAlways
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a tooltip window is displayed even when its parent control is not active.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.InitialDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that passes before the tooltip appears.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.ReshowDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time that must transpire before subsequent tooltip windows appear as the mouse pointer moves from one control to another.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.BackgroundGradient
member.summary: Gets or sets a background gradient for the tooltips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the tooltip window.
member.remarks: This property is useful in case when the property is assigned to an image with transparent or semi-transparent areas.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the tooltip window.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font used to display the tooltip.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tooltip window should display a shadow.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.Border
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tooltip window should display a solid border.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.BorderColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the border drawn around the tooltip when the property is set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image displayed in tooltip window.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.BackgroundImageLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image layout as defined in the enumeration.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.IsBalloon
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tooltip is shown in a balloon shape.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.RoundedCorners
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the tooltip window has rounded corners.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.StripAmpersands
member.summary: Gets or sets whether ampersands in the text should be hidden.
member.remarks: Ampersands should be encoded in HTML as '&' or '&'. Ampersands that are not properly encoded will not be hidden.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.UseFading
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a fade effect should be used when displaying the tooltip.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the tooltips.
member.remarks: This property should be set to a value between zero (totally transparent) and one (totally opaque).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.HitTestVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the tooltip is visible to the mouse.
member.remarks: Set this property to true if you want to add clickable areas to the tooltip, such as hyperlinks. In this case, the tooltip becomes visible to the mouse, it handles the mouse events itself instead of passing them to the control under the tooltip.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.MaximumWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum width of the tooltips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.ToolTipSettings.Images
member.summary: Gets a collection of images that may be shown in the tooltips.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1InputPanel.InputComponent.BoundValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the bound data value associated with this component.

remarks.para: Use this property to bind the component to values that can be null.

For example, the component has a boolean property of type boolean that can be bound to boolean fields, the component has a property of type decimal that can be bound to numeric fields, and the has a property of type that can be bound to date fields.
These are all value types and thus cannot be set to null or . All these properties map internally to the property, which is of type and can be set to null.
